bibl.note: This document is a letter, dated April 21, 1833, from Oscar Hamilton to his mother Sarah Hamilton. In the letter, Oscar writes about his views on education, religion, and updates his mother on the cholera and scarlet fever scare.

div1.p: I received your welcome letter by Mr Moose which gave me a good deal satisfaction to hear from you and my brothers and dear sister. you wrighted to me that Br James is trying to edued himself tell him to press on with redoubled diligene that with a good educatian and a good character he can face the frowns & curses of this wicked world that he can stand as bold and damnless before the wicked decivr as a lyon doth before his prey

My dear Mother I ampoore but I feel myself as independent Boneypart did. I have often wished that I was a poet or some eloquent wrighter that I might paint the innumerable shades which present themselfes before my mind on this subject but perhaps I ame taking up too much paper and time on this subject. Let me speak of something else. You say I am making rapid stride to manhood yes I amknow in my 18th year and all I wish and all I crave is a good educatian and a sure and true relyance on the infinate and almyghty Being. Then will I defy the devil yea then will I defy world to slap my prizes to the summit of fame glory. Oh that I could see my brothers
well educated and become men of literature honour and respectability Nothing could tend to make me more happy than that. But after all I should I shoul be sill more gatrfyed to see them become Releigous. Br an myself are well and we expect to see you in May One of young men has left us and there is but thee of us know Br Mr Batenead and I and we are very busy. B Wells speaks of getting another soon.—

You spoke of the cholera and scalett feve in you letter but there is little? here. Nashville is very healthy and I think if ther is no more sickness then now the Drs will will have to beg ther bread or live on the capital There has been too men murdered in Nashville lately and they have one of the murderes in goal awaiting his tyral which comes on the first of May Its very likely he will be hung as the proof is very evident. There is a good del of of excitement in town to day. The geat Methodist pecher Naphat arrive yesterday and I expect the church will be ? We hear him preach I must bring my letter to a close Mortimer sends his hardest love and best respects to you Brs and sister give my respects to all my acquaintances
and freiends and except the same for you self

closer.salute: I remain you obeidient and affectiarat son
